sect2.title: Introduction to Xpdf
sect2.para: Xpdf is a viewer for Adobe's free Portable Document Format (PDF) which is both fast and small and comes with some useful command-line utilities.

sect4.title: Optional
sect4.para:
or (just the fonts),
t1lib and libpaper

sect2.title: Installation of Xpdf
sect2.para: Install Xpdf by running the following commands:

userinput.command: patch -d xpdf -Np0 -i ../../xpdf-3.00pl1.patch && patch -d xpdf -Np0 -i ../../xpdf-3.00pl2.patch && patch -d xpdf -Np0 -i ../../xpdf-&xpdf-version;.patch && patch -Np1 -i ../xpdf-&xpdf-version;-freetype_2.1.7_hack-2.patch && ./configure --prefix=/usr --sysconfdir=/etc \ --with-freetype2-includes=/usr/include/freetype2 && make && make install

sect2.title: Installation command explanations
sect2.para: --enable-a4-paper: This switch must be added to set DIN A4 as the standard paper format.

sect3.title: Configuration Information
sect3.para: In the /etc directory you will find a sample xpdfrc that can be either copied to ~/.xpdfrc or taken as an example to write your own configuration file.

enableT1lib yes enableFreeType yes antialias yes

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The Xpdf package contains xpdf, pdftops, pdftotext, pdftoppm, pdffonts, pdfimages and pdfinfo.

sect3.title: xpdf
sect3.para: xpdf displays files in PDF format.

sect3.title: pdftops
sect3.para: pdftops converts PDF files to PS format.

sect3.title: pdftotext
sect3.para: pdftotext parses ASCII text from PDF files.

sect3.title: pdftoppm
sect3.para: pdftoppm converts PDF files to PBM, PGM, PPM formats.

sect3.title: pdffonts
sect3.para: pdffonts lists the fonts used in a PDF file along with various information for each font.

sect3.title: pdfimages
sect3.para: pdfimages saves images from a PDF file as PPM, PBM, or JPEG files.

sect3.title: pdfinfo
sect3.para: pdfinfo prints the contents of the 'Info' dictionary (plus some other useful information) from a PDF file.
